concept.title: Enabling Kerberos Authentication
concept.shortdesc: You can use Kerberos authentication to connect to external systems as well as YARN clusters.

conbody.p: Data Collector configuration fileenabling Kerberos authenticationKerberos authenticationenabling for the Data CollectorBy default, uses the user account who started it to connect to external systems. When you enable Kerberos, it can use the Kerberos principal to connect to external systems.

You can configure Kerberos authentication for the following stages:
Hadoop FS origin
Kafka Consumer, only
HBase Lookup processor
Hive Metadata processor
Hadoop FS destination
HBase destination
Hive Metastore destination
Kafka Producer, only
MapR DB destination
MapR FS destination

To enable Kerberos authentication, perform the following steps:
Configure to use Kerberos.
In the configuration file, $SDC_CONF/sdc.properties, configure the following Kerberos properties to enable Kerberos and define the principal and keytab:
Configure the stage to use Kerberos. Cluster pipelines automatically use Kerberos authentication if the YARN cluster requires it and if has Kerberos enabled.
